title: What was an especially awkward interaction a Beatle or Beatles had with fans? - Quora

response.answer_text: They had multiple interactions that made John Lennon particularly uncomfortable. At the height of Beatlemania disabled fans would be presented to The Beatles backstage before a concert and Lennon felt that they looked up at them as if The Beatles could heal their ailments. That pressure, coupled with his signature “crip” spasmodic behavior, certainly helped add to the reasons why they decided to stop touring (along with the inability to hear themselves and the controversy that followed them everywhere).

I don’t know if this would count. English singer Helen Shapiro was singing to George and he took a slight swing toward her . She had the biggest surprise expecting that. Of course George made up for that by stooping down with his hands clenched, looking innocently up at her. .
